metadata.content: This was the best app for any song enthusiast who loved streaming music or listening to podcasts online, but now the above cannot be said. The app has finally shifted towards making and maximizing profit and giving less and less features which are basic in other applications. The (basic) features are also being stripped away such as playing whatever song we like, skipping songs, etc. The experience has now deteriorated to a level that the app is now very hard to use on a regular basis.

metadata.content: Spotify's approach to charging for every basic function is extremely disappointing. Not only are users bombarded with ads unless they pay up, but even basic features like looping songs or fast-forwarding/backwarding are behind a paywall. It's frustrating to feel nickel-and-dimed for every little convenience. Considering the plethora of other streaming options available, Spotify's restrictive and monetized approach leaves much to be desired.

metadata.content: Please bring back the Enhance feature! Using Enhance, I could build massive playlists starting with only a few songs. It was amazing for music discovery, one of the main reasons I use Spotify. There was absolutely no reason to remove that entirely unobtrusive feature, and nothing else Spotify offers is comparable. I could easily see which songs were suggested and quickly add the ones I liked. Giving a kid candy and then taking it away is just mean. I've had premium for years. How disappointing.
metadata.replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback! In lieu of Enhance, we now have Smart Shuffle: support.spotify.com/article/shuffle-play/. If you want to find other ways to add songs based on your playlist’s vibe you can always scroll at the end of your playlist and check out the recommended songs for you.

metadata.content: After many years of happily using the Spotify mobile app on several Android phones, within the past few months, it's become non-functional. The home screen MIGHT load, and if I can get a second screen to load (which is rarely if ever), it can't play a song. Even if my phone and desktop are on the same wi-fi, the mobile app does not recognize the second device and I can't switch between them. No matter how many times I uninstall and reinstall the app, this has only gotten worse. Please fix ASAP.

metadata.content: Spotify is a great app. I have been a premium user for several years now and have had a great overall experience. With the notable exception of the last month. The app has been consistently breaking, not connecting to the internet. As a premium user, I think, "Well, that's okay, I download all my music for a reason." But that doesn't even remotely matter when the app is still CONSTANTLY loading, even in offline mode, as if it were trying to connect to the weakest of weak signals. Fix this.

metadata.content: The addition of smart shuffle has been awful. Switching between shuffle on and off has become buggy, requiring repeated turning off and on for it to stay off when switching between songs. When you want to stop shuffling at one song so you can go to the next in the playlist, it resets to the first song in the playlist, rather than where you were at. It's unintuitive, annoying, and buggy. This feature alone makes me want to switch entirely to SoundCloud.

main_text: The addition of smart shuffle has been awful. Switching between shuffle on and off has become buggy, requiring repeated turning off and on for it to stay off when switching between songs. When you want to stop shuffling at one song so you can go to the next in the playlist, it resets to the first song in the playlist, rather than where you were at. It's unintuitive, annoying, and buggy. This feature alone makes me want to switch entirely to SoundCloud.

metadata.content: As for Spotify features and catalogue, I am realistic and don't have much complaints. But the app, man, it often acts unresponsive as if it doesn't know what to do! The issue persists even if the app is fully whitelisted from battery optimizations. But the most glaring issue for me would be the downloads disappearing and the storage switching back from SD card to internal storage after simply restarting the device! For my playlists with thousands of songs in very high quality, it's too annoying.
metadata.replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear that. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

metadata.content: As many others (both here and on the Spotify forums) have noted, there's an increasingly widespread bug (esp on Android devices) that affects song playback, causing songs to "play" with no audio until songs are manually skipped. I've been dealing with this bug for over a year, and it has only become more frequent, rather than being addressed. CS has offered no helpful advice. I've been a Premium subscriber for 10 years, but enough is enough. I'm switching to Tidal, and you probably should too.
